title: Jordan B Peterson, Whittaker Chambers, and Ludwig von Mises: Profiles in Action, Value and Courage
description:
We consider the crossover in the ideas of Jordan Peterson, Whittaker Chambers (his great book, Witness) and Ludwig von Mises (author of Human Action, Socialism, and many other great works of Austrian economics).

A primer on Austrian Economics from fee.org (which is an excellent website as a resource on economics in general):  https://fee.org/articles/understanding-austrian-economics/

Documentary on Ludwig von Moses:  https://youtu.be/ugHQcHpFfe0

An excellent lecture summarizing Whittaker Chambers' book Witness and talking about his life.
https://youtu.be/mNlTigcvcpM

Live footage of Whittaker Chambers testifying before the House UnAmerican Activities Committee
https://youtu.be/lL1zpNfqEOc

A brief tribute to Whittaker Chambers:  https://youtu.be/3cXOcFkqB6g

Books by or about Whittaker Chambers:

Odyssey of a Friend: Letters to William F. Buckley, Jr.
Ghosts on the Roof, a compilation of Chambers' journalistic writings

Books by or about Ludwig von Mises
Human Action
Socialism
My Years with Ludwig von Mises by Margit von Mises
Mises, the Last Knight of Liberalism, by Hulsmann

Search page listing Lectures, pdf's and videos about 
I, Pencil by Leonard Reed, a classic explanation of the complexity of what can be 
accomplished by a multitude of free individuals

Man, Economy and State by Murray Rothbard, a disciple of von Mises

Also mentioned:

Edith Stein, a top student of Edmund Husserl who was killed by the Nazis and later beatified.

Robert Barnes
Bionic Mosquito
Lew Rockwell, who founded the von Mises Institute
